Why do some antivirus programs like Avast and Kaspersky flag this software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Avast and Kaspersky may flag this software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" because it is mining software, which can be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can review the resources provided to learn more about it.
